articles.headline: Peter Thiel’s Money Talks, in Contentious Ways. But What Does He Say?
articles.snippet: In a rare interview, the billionaire Facebook board member and Trump supporter shared his current takes on politics, Silicon Valley and more after “a crazier two years than I would have thought.”
articles.abstract: In a rare interview, the billionaire Facebook board member and Trump supporter shared his current takes on politics, Silicon Valley and more after “a crazier two years than I would have thought.”
articles.lead_paragraph: Peter Thiel is Silicon Valley’s homegrown Cassandra. He warned for years that the big tech companies were arrogant and clueless and less good for mankind than they believed.

articles.headline: Trump Prepares to Formalize Tariffs but Floats Exemptions
articles.snippet: The administration is expected to formally announce tariffs on Thursday despite pushback from Republican lawmakers and as officials began signaling carve-outs for certain countries.
articles.abstract: The administration is expected to formally announce tariffs on Thursday despite pushback from Republican lawmakers and as officials began signaling carve-outs for certain countries.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — More than 100 Republican lawmakers implored President Trump to drop plans for stiff and sweeping steel and aluminum tariffs as the White House prepared to formalize the measures on Thursday afternoon. Officials said late Wednesday that the plan would initially exempt Canada and Mexico and could ultimately exclude other allies.

articles.headline: China’s Huawei Is at Center of Fight Over 5G’s Future
articles.snippet: China was a bit player in shaping today’s cellular networks. Now, as 5G approaches, Huawei is determined to lead, worrying Washington.
articles.abstract: China was a bit player in shaping today’s cellular networks. Now, as 5G approaches, Huawei is determined to lead, worrying Washington.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — When top tech minds sat down to set the global standards underpinning today’s cellphone networks, China was left largely on the sidelines. Companies in the West owned much of the crucial technology, and they prospered.

articles.headline: Ad Agencies’ Reckoning on Sexual Harassment Comes on Instagram, Anonymously
articles.snippet: The @DietMadisonAve account is the industry’s version of a spreadsheet that detailed misbehavior by men in the media field. Like that list, the account has fans and detractors.
articles.abstract: The @DietMadisonAve account is the industry’s version of a spreadsheet that detailed misbehavior by men in the media field. Like that list, the account has fans and detractors.
articles.lead_paragraph: The advertising industry, expert in the art of attention getting, has found itself riveted in recent months by an anonymously run Instagram account dedicated to exposing sexual harassment on Madison Avenue.

articles.headline: Trump Lawyer Obtained Restraining Order to Silence Stormy Daniels
articles.snippet: The order was obtained last week to keep the woman quiet about an affair she is alleged to have had with President Trump.
articles.abstract: The order was obtained last week to keep the woman quiet about an affair she is alleged to have had with President Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s lawyer secretly obtained a temporary restraining order last week to prevent a pornographic film star from speaking out about her alleged affair with Mr. Trump, according to legal documents and interviews.
articles.byline: By Jim Rutenberg and Peter Baker

articles.headline: Sessions Targets California Immigrants Using a Ruling That Protected Them
articles.snippet: The principle of federal supremacy over immigration established in a Supreme Court ruling in favor of the Obama administration could help the Trump Justice Department advance a different goal.
articles.abstract: The principle of federal supremacy over immigration established in a Supreme Court ruling in favor of the Obama administration could help the Trump Justice Department advance a different goal.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Attorney General Jeff Sessions sued California this week for not doing enough to find and punish unauthorized immigrants, and said on Wednesday he was girding for an epic battle.

articles.headline: In Trump’s White House, the Adviser Who Really Matters Sits in the Oval Office
articles.snippet: As aides head for the doors in record numbers, President Trump increasingly relies on his own judgment, in effect operating a presidency of one.
articles.abstract: As aides head for the doors in record numbers, President Trump increasingly relies on his own judgment, in effect operating a presidency of one.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump once said “I alone can fix it.” Looks like he may have to. No one else seems to be sticking around.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: How Xi Jinping Made His Power Grab: With Stealth, Speed and Guile
articles.snippet: Mr. Xi basked in applause at the opening of China’s parliament. But his plan to end presidential term limits showed his mastery of back-room politics.
articles.abstract: Mr. Xi basked in applause at the opening of China’s parliament. But his plan to end presidential term limits showed his mastery of back-room politics.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Some 200 senior Communist Party officials gathered behind closed doors in January to take up a momentous political decision: whether to abolish presidential term limits and enable Xi Jinping to lead China for a generation.

articles.headline: Cigna to Buy Express Scripts in $52 Billion Health Care Deal
articles.snippet: The transaction comes as insurers and others are looking for ways to control costs and stave off future challenges from companies like Amazon.
articles.abstract: The transaction comes as insurers and others are looking for ways to control costs and stave off future challenges from companies like Amazon.
articles.lead_paragraph: The health insurance giant Cigna said on Thursday that it had agreed to buy Express Scripts, the nation’s largest pharmacy benefit manager, in a $52 billion deal that could further reshape the roiling health care landscape.
articles.byline: By Katie Thomas, Reed Abelson and Chad Bray
